Reviews.Title: Laptop>> Thumbsup... Windows 8>> Pffffft...!!
Reviews.Author: A. Adray "givesuhe11"
Reviews.Content: I was looking to upgrade my HTPC...My Parameters were:Quad-coreRam expandable to 16GBHDMI and Gigabit EthernetAll as cheap as humanly possible...This Toshiba fit the bill and I got it on sale for $379+an upgrade to 8GB ram+ a 2TB NAS storage (on sale also)All that for $500!! This baby runs XBMC like a DEMON...BUT........ I HATE Windows 8!! It's a phone/tablet Operating System on a PC... I've had to run several third party programs to make it look and feel like a PC OS again... With a normal desktop and a start button with programs there..."Metro" SUCKS!!! (on a PC)... I can see it's usefulness on a phone or tab but IMNSHO, it's worthless on a PC...The only good thing out of the box on Windows 8 is it's networking capability... Seamless and zero problems with it4 stars for the hardware... one star off because of Win8

Reviews.Title: Price wins all.
Reviews.Author: ~JoeyThePCguy~
Reviews.Content: When looking at various models vs price vs specs, for the priceline this is a ->great buy<-. What they do not list is that the CPU actually has a 2.5MB cache size & I do think that is a key selling point 101 for anyone who understands the numbers. Onto the important things.Pros:-Solid Touchscreen windows system under $460-750GB (- updates & programming leaves 600+GB left.)-Quad-Core CPU-Enhanced Graphics Chip (If you upgrade with more memory it only gets better)-Free Windows 8.1 Upgrade/Update, if you choose it. (Not a given with every windows 8 pc being sold right now)-Max battery life 8+ hours with no extra parts added & running in eco/power save mode with low-mid level use.  (If you upgrade memory/parts then you have to account for those pulling away from the normal rated battery life times)Cons:Looking at what you pay for I myself couldn't find any.I paired this with the below items & turned it into a power house for a local awesome teacher. She loves the performance & all the bells/whistles for under $1000, that's truly how you come out a happy shopper is buying what you want & making it your own.  Hope the info helps anyone needing it.  Also the VStart software in many cases helps many people wanting to give their system that same windows 7 look & feel, while still keeping the windows 8 visuals still around.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004MJZ5HS/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_3http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002AQSTXM/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BWF5U0M/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_4http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004ZEZB88/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004AB70US/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_5

Reviews.Title: Good for everyday tasks
Reviews.Author: harold
Reviews.Content: Well, I was in the market for another Toshiba. I had a great experience with my older Sat-A505D-S6008 and decided to give it shot.Pros:Responsive touch screenGood battery lifeUser FriendlyCons:Tends to be a bit sluggish at timesCheap feel to itThe sound isn't all that impressiveI'd suggest this laptop for the average user that isn't looking for a very "techy" laptop. It's a good starter laptop that offers the basics in modern day web browsing.
